original: bdag gis ni sdig pa byas shing gang bdag gis dge 'dun gyi dbyen la sogs pa ngan par spyod pa dag byas te de ji ltar bya zhes bsam pa las /
analyzed: bdag gis ni sdig pa byas shing gang bdag gis dge 'dun gyi dbyen la sogs pa ngan par spyod pa dag byas te de ji ltar bya zhes bsam pa las /
translated: I have committed sins and done evil deeds such as causing a schism in the Sangha. What should I do?

original: ji tsam na rdzogs byed de'i thad du 'ongs te /
analyzed: ji tsam na rdzogs byed de'i thad du 'ongs te /
translated: Then he went to P≈´ra·πáa and asked him.

original: rdza ma'i bum pa chag pa bzhin du shi nas ni yang skye ba med do zhes @73a * //
analyzed: rdza ma'i bum pa chag pa bzhin du shi nas ni yang skye ba med do zhes @73a * //
translated: P≈´ra·πáa said, ‚ÄúYou are dead like a broken clay pot. You will not be reborn again.‚Äù

original: smras pa dang / ji tsam na lha sbyin lta ba log par skyes par gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa dang / ji tsam na lha sbyin lta ba log par skyes par gyur te /
translated: Then Devadatta developed wrong views.

original: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //üîΩbyis pas bstod pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so // byis pas bstod pa gang yin pa //
translated: This verse was spoken with reference to him.üîΩWhat is praised by fools

original: zhes bya ba ni gang rdzogs byed la sogs pa'i glen pas bsngags pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang rdzogs byed la sogs pa'i glen pas bsngags pa brjod pa'o //
translated: is praised by fools such as P≈´ra·πáa.

original: mkhas pas smad gang yin zhes bya ba ni blo dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: mkhas pas smad gang yin zhes bya ba ni blo dang ldan pa ste /
translated: What is despised by the wise

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pas gsungs shing smad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pas gsungs shing smad pa'o //
translated: is despised by the wise such as the TathƒÅgata.

original: de gnyis las gang mchog yin zhe na /üîΩmkhas pas smad pa ches rung gis //
analyzed: de gnyis las gang mchog yin zhe na / mkhas pas smad pa ches rung gis //
translated: Which of these two is superior?

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: It is better to be despised by the wiseüîΩthan to be praised by fools.

original: mkhas pa dag gis smad pa ni ches rung ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag gis smad pa ni ches rung ste /
translated: It is quite proper that the wise should despise it.

original: khyad par rnam pa sna chogs ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa sna chogs ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of various kinds of distinctions.

original: byis pas bstod pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: byis pas bstod pa mi rung ngo //
translated: Praise by fools is improper.

original: zhes bya ba ni skye bo glen pa las rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bsngags pa'i tshig brjod pa thos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye bo glen pa las rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bsngags pa'i tshig brjod pa thos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not hearing the expression of various kinds of praise from stupid people.

original: skyon rnam pa sna tshogs dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon rnam pa sna tshogs dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is connected with various kinds of faults.

original: des na de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du byis pa dang bsten pa las bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du byis pa dang bsten pa las bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, for that reason, in every way, one should turn away from associating with fools.

original: byis pa bsten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: byis pa bsten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúOne should avoid associating with fools. . . . ‚Äù

original: byis pa mi thos shing zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rna pas thos pa'i yul du yang mi 'gyur ba de ltar 'bad par bya ste /
analyzed: byis pa mi thos shing zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rna pas thos pa'i yul du yang mi 'gyur ba de ltar 'bad par bya ste /
translated: One should not hear fools, i.e., one should strive not to hear them as objects of the ears.

original: thos par gyur na yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang nyes par spyod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis ngan song gi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos par gyur na yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang nyes par spyod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis ngan song gi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if one does hear them, they are the cause of the lower realms because they are the condition for passion, hatred, and evil conduct.

original: nam yang mthong ba'i gnas su gnas par mi bya ste /
analyzed: nam yang mthong ba'i gnas su gnas par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not stay in a place where one is seen.

original: re zhig yang snga ma gnyis spang bar 'dod pas brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig yang snga ma gnyis spang bar 'dod pas brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should examine the first two [alternatives] for a while, if one wishes to avoid them.

original: gal te re zhig na byis pa de las gzhan med de thos par gyur na ci nas mi mthong ba de ltar 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te re zhig na byis pa de las gzhan med de thos par gyur na ci nas mi mthong ba de ltar 'bad par bya'o //
translated: If one is seen by a fool, one should make an effort not to be seen by anyone else.

original: de la de mthong bas kyang shin du sdig pa la goms shing spyod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de mthong bas kyang shin du sdig pa la goms shing spyod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, even if one is seen by him, it is possible that one will become very familiar with and practice evil.

original: 'gro ba la sogs pa'i spyod yul gyi lam du yang gdung bar byed rab tu gdung ba skyed par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba la sogs pa'i spyod yul gyi lam du yang gdung bar byed rab tu gdung ba skyed par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: One should also be distressed and generate great distress on the path of conduct such as going.

original: ma bsten gyur pa nyid rung ngo //
analyzed: ma bsten gyur pa nyid rung ngo //
translated: It is suitable to not rely on them at all.

original: zhes bya ba ni byis pa dang gnas gcig tu nams kyang gnas par mi bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byis pa dang gnas gcig tu nams kyang gnas par mi bya ste /
translated: This means that one should never stay in the same place as a fool.

original: gal te snga ma gnyis spangs par ma nus na lhan cig gnas pa ni gcig tu spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te snga ma gnyis spangs par ma nus na lhan cig gnas pa ni gcig tu spang bar bya'o //
translated: If one is unable to avoid the first two [alternatives], one should completely avoid staying together.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: byis pa bsten pa sdug bsngal zhing //
analyzed: byis pa bsten pa sdug bsngal zhing //
translated: Because relying on fools is suffering.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ltar byis pa dang lhan cig gnas pa ni sdug bsngal ba ste bsod nams 'dod @73b pa dang sdig pa ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ltar byis pa dang lhan cig gnas pa ni sdug bsngal ba ste bsod nams 'dod @73b pa dang sdig pa ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i dngos po ste /
translated: Thus, it is painful to live with the childish, because merit and sin are mutually exclusive things.

original: de skyed pas mngon par mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skyed pas mngon par mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they produce sin, they are the result of what is not desired.

original: dgra 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni dper na dgra ral gri brdeg par gzo ba dang lhan cig gnas pa ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: dgra 'dra bas zhes bya ba ni dper na dgra ral gri brdeg par gzo ba dang lhan cig gnas pa ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Like enemies, means that it is painful to live with those who are skilled at striking with swords, like enemies.

original: rnam pa kun du zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad du de bzhin no /
analyzed: rnam pa kun du zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad du de bzhin no /
translated: In every way, means in every respect, just as it was explained above.

original: de ltar na gong dang lhan cig bsten na sdug bsngal ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na gong dang lhan cig bsten na sdug bsngal ma yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúIs it not painful to live with the wise in the same way?,‚ÄùüîΩthe verse says, ‚Äúbut it is pleasant to live with the steadfast.‚Äù

original: brtan pa zhes bya ba ste mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa zhes bya ba ste mkhas pa'o //
translated: The steadfast are the wise.

original: bsten na bde bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gang la brten na bde bar 'gyur ba dag ni bde bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsten na bde bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gang la brten na bde bar 'gyur ba dag ni bde bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is pleasant to live with them, means that it is pleasant to live with those who are pleasant to live with.

original: gnyen dang phrad pa ji lta bar //
analyzed: gnyen dang phrad pa ji lta bar //
translated: Like meeting with friends,

original: zhes bya ba ni pha dang ma la sogs pa'i gnyen dang rang ci dga' ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha dang ma la sogs pa'i gnyen dang rang ci dga' ba ste /
translated: One should not be attached to friends such as one's father and mother, or to what one likes.

original: rang bzhin pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i bu la sogs pa dang phrad na bde zhing ji ltar yid tshim par byed pa de bzhin du des na de'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i bu la sogs pa dang phrad na bde zhing ji ltar yid tshim par byed pa de bzhin du des na de'i phyir /
translated: This is because one is happy and satisfied when one meets with relatives such as one's father and mother, and with one's own son and so on who have the natural good qualities.üîΩTherefore, for that reason,

original: de bas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says,

original: gang gi phyir byis pa bsten pa ni bde ba ma yin pa'i rgyur gyur ba de bas na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byis pa bsten pa ni bde ba ma yin pa'i rgyur gyur ba de bas na'o //
translated: therefore because relying on the childish is the cause of unhappiness.

original: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtan pa zhes bya ba ni blo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The wise means the intelligent.

original: yang na de brtan pa dang ldan pas blo'i 'bras bu des blo yod par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na de brtan pa dang ldan pas blo'i 'bras bu des blo yod par rtogs pa ste /
translated: Or, because they possess that stability, their intelligence is understood to exist by means of the result of intelligence.

original: du bas me bzhin no //
analyzed: du bas me bzhin no //
translated: Like fire by smoke.

original: 'dis ni rigs pas thob pa'i shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rigs pas thob pa'i shes pa bstan to //
translated: This shows knowledge obtained through reasoning.

original: thos mang zhes bya ba ni sde snod gsum thos la rtogs pa'i blo yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos mang zhes bya ba ni sde snod gsum thos la rtogs pa'i blo yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Much learning means learning the three baskets and having the intelligence of understanding.

original: 'dis ni thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab bstan te /
translated: This shows the wisdom that arises from hearing and reflection.

original: bsams pa med par ni thos pa'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsams pa med par ni thos pa'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result of hearing does not exist without reflection.

original: mchog 'dren byed pa dang zhes bya ba la mchog ni khyad par can bsgoms pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: mchog 'dren byed pa dang zhes bya ba la mchog ni khyad par can bsgoms pa las byung ba ste /
translated: The supreme is the special one, which arises from cultivation.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha yongs su blangs nas mchog 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha yongs su blangs nas mchog 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it leads to the supreme, having taken up the factors conducive to penetration.

original: khyad par gyi shes pa skye ba'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par gyi shes pa skye ba'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the basis for the arising of special knowledge, he says:

original: tshul khrims ldan dang brtul zhugs can //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshul khrims ldan dang brtul zhugs can // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Endowed with morality and austerities,

original: tshul khrims ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba las ldog pa'o //
translated: Morality is turning away from natural offenses.

original: brtul zhugs ni bcas pa'i kha na tho ba las ldog pa ste /
analyzed: brtul zhugs ni bcas pa'i kha na tho ba las ldog pa ste /
translated: Austerities are turning away from offenses proscribed by the Buddha.

original: de gnyis ka dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ka dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One is endowed with both of these.

original: yang na 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tshul khrims sam so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang dbang po sdom pa go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tshul khrims sam so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang dbang po sdom pa go rims bzhin no //
translated: Alternatively, morality is the way of engagement, or the vow of individual liberation, and austerity is the way of disengagement, or the vow of sense restraint, respectively.

original: de ltar tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i dbang gis 'phags pa'i @74a * //
analyzed: de ltar tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i dbang gis 'phags pa'i @74a * //
translated: Thus, by the power of completing the accumulations, the noble path arises.

original: lam mngon sum du 'gyur pa'i phyir 'phags pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lam mngon sum du 'gyur pa'i phyir 'phags pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They are called ‚Äúnoble‚Äù because they directly perceive the path.

original: mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam skyes pa'i phyir te sdig pa las ring du gyur pa'i phyir 'phags pa zhes bya'o zhes mdo las bshad do //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam skyes pa'i phyir te sdig pa las ring du gyur pa'i phyir 'phags pa zhes bya'o zhes mdo las bshad do //
translated: They are called ‚Äúnoble‚Äù because they are far removed from evil, because the path of seeing and so on has arisen.

original: gtsor 'phags pa zhes bstan pa ni khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dgra bcom pa la brjod do //
analyzed: gtsor 'phags pa zhes bstan pa ni khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dgra bcom pa la brjod do //
translated: The term ‚Äúnoble‚Äù is taught primarily in the sense of an arhat who is free from the attachment of the three realms.

original: rang gi bya ba mtha' dag gi bya ba byas pa'i phyir gzhan dag la brtse ldan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rang gi bya ba mtha' dag gi bya ba byas pa'i phyir gzhan dag la brtse ldan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They are called ‚Äúcompassionate‚Äù because they have performed all that needs to be done for themselves and they are concerned for others.

original: gzhan dag la phan 'dogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag la phan 'dogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they benefit others.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi mchog ces bya ba bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de la brten par gyis shig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi mchog ces bya ba bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de la brten par gyis shig ces bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, rely on them, because they are the best of men, because they are endowed with the perfection of benefit for self and others.

original: gnas par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gnas par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Rely on them means to abide in them.

original: gang yin zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na smras pa /
translated: What are they?

original: blo bzang zhes bya ba phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: blo bzang zhes bya ba phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: They are called ‚Äúthose of good intellect,‚Äù because they have unmistaken realization.

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrgyu skar lam du zla ba ltar //
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to // rgyu skar lam du zla ba ltar //
translated: The meaning of wise is the meaning of scholar.üîΩLike the moon in the path of the stars.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu skar rnams kyi lam nam mkha' la zla ba ji lta bar brten gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu skar rnams kyi lam nam mkha' la zla ba ji lta bar brten gyi /
translated: Just as the moon is in the sky, in the path of the stars,üîΩnot on the ground,

original: sa'i steng du ma yin pa de bzhin du blo dang ldan pa dam pa bsten pa ste /
analyzed: sa'i steng du ma yin pa de bzhin du blo dang ldan pa dam pa bsten pa ste /
translated: so too is the wise one to be relied upon,

original: byis pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not the fool.

original: dper na ston gyi dus su nam mkha' sgrib pas ma gos pa'i yar gyi ngo la zla ba brten cing 'jug pa ni nyin re zhing phun sum tshogs pa 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na ston gyi dus su nam mkha' sgrib pas ma gos pa'i yar gyi ngo la zla ba brten cing 'jug pa ni nyin re zhing phun sum tshogs pa 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: For example, in autumn, when the sky is clear and unobstructed, the moon in the sky, in the path of the stars, shines forth, and its perfection increases day by day.

original: de bzhin du skyes bu dam pa mkhas pa bsten pa yang nyin re zhing spro ba dang yid tshim pa dang dad pa la sogs pa mngon par 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes bu dam pa mkhas pa bsten pa yang nyin re zhing spro ba dang yid tshim pa dang dad pa la sogs pa mngon par 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Similarly, when one relies on a wise, holy person, day by day one's joy, satisfaction, faith, and so on increase. This is the meaning.

original: mdza' bshes kyi tshoms te nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs s+ho /
analyzed: mdza' bshes kyi tshoms te nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs s+ho /
translated: This completes the commentary on the twenty-fifth chapter, on friends, in the Treatise on the Classification of Karma.

original: // / sdig pa spangs pa dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pas 'khor ba na phun sum tshogs par yang ma zad de don thams cad kyi bla na med par gyur pa mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: // / sdig pa spangs pa dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pas 'khor ba na phun sum tshogs par yang ma zad de don thams cad kyi bla na med par gyur pa mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Not only does one attain excellence in cyclic existence through abandoning evil and relying on a spiritual guide, but one also attains nirvana, which is unsurpassed among all goals.

original: de bsgrub pa'i phyir tshoms 'di'i 'og tu de bshad do //
analyzed: de bsgrub pa'i phyir tshoms 'di'i 'og tu de bshad do //
translated: In order to accomplish that, the next chapter will explain that.

original: rus sbal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rus sbal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse begins with ‚Äútortoise.‚Äù

original: mnyan yod na bcom ldan 'das chu klung rgyu zhing gshegs pa na chu bo'i phyogs nas srog chags rus sbal byung ste spyod yul du song ngo //
analyzed: mnyan yod na bcom ldan 'das chu klung rgyu zhing gshegs pa na chu bo'i phyogs nas srog chags rus sbal byung ste spyod yul du song ngo //
translated: When the Blessed One was traveling along the riverbank at Shravasti, a tortoise emerged from the river and went into his range of activity.

original: wa zhig gis de mthong ste bza' ba'i phyir rjes su 'brangs so //
analyzed: wa zhig gis de mthong ste bza' ba'i phyir rjes su 'brangs so //
translated: A fox saw it and followed it in order to eat it.

original: des kyang de mthong ste rang nyid @74b yan lag rnams khog pa'i nang du bsdus pa gzigs nas dge slong dag srog chags rus sbal was 'jigs nas rang gi yan lag rnams khog pa'i nang du bsdus pa de bzhin du khyed cag gis kyang zhes bya ba'i bar
analyzed: des kyang de mthong ste rang nyid @74b yan lag rnams khog pa'i nang du bsdus pa gzigs nas dge slong dag srog chags rus sbal was 'jigs nas rang gi yan lag rnams khog pa'i nang du bsdus pa de bzhin du khyed cag gis kyang zhes bya ba'i bar
translated: The Buddha saw this and said to the monks, ‚ÄúMonks, just as the tortoise drew its limbs into its shell for fear of the weasel, so you should draw in your limbs, that is, your faculties, into the mind, and then dwell.‚Äù

original: du ste de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: du ste de'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di gsungs so //
translated: This was said with reference to that.

original: rus sbal ltar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srog chags rus sbal lta bur ro //
analyzed: rus sbal ltar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srog chags rus sbal lta bur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúLike a tortoise‚Äù means like a tortoise animal.

original: yan lag ni lag pa dang rkang pa dang mgo'i tshul te lus kyi yan lag lnga yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag ni lag pa dang rkang pa dang mgo'i tshul te lus kyi yan lag lnga yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúLimbs‚Äù means the five limbs of the body, that is, the hands, feet, head, etc.

original: rang gi khog par zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi kham bor kha sbyar ba lta bu la lus bcug pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi khog par zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi kham bor kha sbyar ba lta bu la lus bcug pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúInto its shell‚Äù means into the mouth of its own body, as if it were a cave.

original: lus bsdus pa ni bcug pa dang sbas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus bsdus pa ni bcug pa dang sbas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúDrawing in the limbs‚Äù means putting them in and hiding them.

original: gang gi phyir de ni spyod yul du 'gro ba na yan lag lnga sbubs nas phyung ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni spyod yul du 'gro ba na yan lag lnga sbubs nas phyung ste /
translated: Because when the tortoise goes to its domain, it draws out its limbs from its shell.

original: ci 'dod par rgyu ba las wa la sogs pa gnod par byed pa dag mthong na yan lag sbed par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci 'dod par rgyu ba las wa la sogs pa gnod par byed pa dag mthong na yan lag sbed par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: When he sees a fox or the like, which are harmful, he conceals his limbs.

original: dge slong yid kyi rnam rtog nang bsdus nas //
analyzed: dge slong yid kyi rnam rtog nang bsdus nas //
translated: The monk, having withdrawn his mental conceptions inward,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says.

analyzed: nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste /

analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po med na ni nad nas 'byung ba mi rigs so //

analyzed: par yod dam med ce na bshad pa /

analyzed: yod do zhes bya ba'i don gyis bstan to //

analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul yang rjes su myong bar mi 'gyur zhing bdag nyid dal ba'i rjes su sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul yang rjes su myong bar mi 'gyur zhing bdag nyid dal ba'i rjes su sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they engage in sense objects for the sake of pleasure.

original: mig dang ldan pas de dag mthong ba na des de dag lhag par zhen par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mig dang ldan pas de dag mthong ba na des de dag lhag par zhen par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: When those with eyes see them, they do not become attached to them.

original: de dag de ltar mi byed ces bya ba ni de ltar gnyis kyi nang du mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag de ltar mi byed ces bya ba ni de ltar gnyis kyi nang du mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: They do not act in that way means that they do not engage in that way, in the two extremes.

original: de dag de ltar mi sems zhes bya ba ni nang gi gnyis kyis bdag gir byed pa mi skyed pa dang lam ma yin pa gzhan dag la mi ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dag de ltar mi sems zhes bya ba ni nang gi gnyis kyis bdag gir byed pa mi skyed pa dang lam ma yin pa gzhan dag la mi ston pa'o //
translated: They do not think in that way means that the two internal ones do not generate appropriation and do not teach other paths.

original: de dag gis chos rjes su mi gdags pa 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni de dag bdag nyid chen po de dag gis kun du sbyor ba thams cad yang dag par spangs pa'i phyir bag chags dang / las kyi bdag nyid chos kyi rnam pa thob par byed pa'i lam med de /
analyzed: de dag gis chos rjes su mi gdags pa 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni de dag bdag nyid chen po de dag gis kun du sbyor ba thams cad yang dag par spangs pa'i phyir bag chags dang / las kyi bdag nyid chos kyi rnam pa thob par byed pa'i lam med de /
translated: They do not designate the Dharma in this way means that because those great beings have completely abandoned all the fetters, they do not have a path that would cause them to obtain the aspects of the Dharma that are the nature of traces and karma.

original: gang gi 'gro bas 'di dag tu gdags shing rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi 'gro bas 'di dag tu gdags shing rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because by going to those, they are designated and established here.

original: lha'am mi ma yin pa yang rung ngo //
analyzed: lha'am mi ma yin pa yang rung ngo //
translated: Whether it is a god or a non-human.

original: 'di lta bu 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba thams cad las rnam par 'das pa skad cig ma nang gi gnyis yongs su spangs pa bar ma'i lam rab tu bsgrub pas so //
analyzed: 'di lta bu 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba thams cad las rnam par 'das pa skad cig ma nang gi gnyis yongs su spangs pa bar ma'i lam rab tu bsgrub pas so //
translated: This is like this means that by completely abandoning the two internal moments that transcend all migrations, the intermediate path is well established.

original: des mthong par byed pa ste mig gis ni ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des mthong par byed pa ste mig gis ni ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The eye sees as it is.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that, he says,

original: ji ltar chu bur mthong ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar chu bur mthong ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: As one sees a bubble, etc.

original: rgyal rigs su btsas zhes bya ba ni 'chi bdag gis 'jigs nas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa btsun pa thabs gang gis bdag 'chi bdag gi rgyal pos mthong bar mi 'gyur zhes zhus pa dang / des na tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyal rigs su btsas zhes bya ba ni 'chi bdag gis 'jigs nas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa btsun pa thabs gang gis bdag 'chi bdag gi rgyal pos mthong bar mi 'gyur zhes zhus pa dang / des na tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: The one born into the Kshatriya caste, etc. means that, fearing the Lord of Death, he asked the Lord, Venerable One, by what means will I not be seen by the Lord of Death? Then the two verses were spoken.

original: gzhan dag ni rgyal byed kyi tshal na dge slong lnga brgya lta ba log pa de'i dbang du mdzad do zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rgyal byed kyi tshal na dge slong lnga brgya lta ba log pa de'i dbang du mdzad do zhe'o //
translated: Others say that the five hundred monks in Jetavana were the object of the wrong view.

original: chu bur mthong ba ni ji ltar mtsho chen po la char gyi thigs pa shin tu sbom pa 'bab pa las rlung gis bskyod na chu'i 'brum bu gzhan skye bar @99b 'gyur zhing 'gag par 'gyur ba de mig dang ldan pa'i skyes bus mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu bur mthong ba ni ji ltar mtsho chen po la char gyi thigs pa shin tu sbom pa 'bab pa las rlung gis bskyod na chu'i 'brum bu gzhan skye bar @99b 'gyur zhing 'gag par 'gyur ba de mig dang ldan pa'i skyes bus mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: The appearance of bubbles is like when a great rain falls with very large drops on a great lake, and when stirred by the wind, the bubbles of water arise and cease, and are seen by a person with eyes.

original: ji ltar smig rgyu mthong ba ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar smig rgyu mthong ba ltar //
translated: As for the appearance of mirages,

original: zhes bya ba ni dper na 'ga' zhig 'brog dgon par skom pa sa gdungs shing tsha bas nyam thag la rab tu gdungs shing tsha bas chu ltar snang ba'i smig rgyu ri dags skom pa skye ba dang 'jigs pa yang mthong ba de ltar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dper na 'ga' zhig 'brog dgon par skom pa sa gdungs shing tsha bas nyam thag la rab tu gdungs shing tsha bas chu ltar snang ba'i smig rgyu ri dags skom pa skye ba dang 'jigs pa yang mthong ba de ltar /
translated: it is like when someone is tormented by thirst in a desert, and is afflicted by heat, and is tormented by heat, and sees a mirage that appears as water, and the deer that are thirsty are born and perish.

original: de bzhin 'jig rten lta byed pa //
analyzed: de bzhin 'jig rten lta byed pa //
translated: In the same way, the world is seen.

original: zhes bya ba yang sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten la bye brag med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten la bye brag med par bstan pa'o //
translated: This also teaches that there is no distinction between the world of sentient beings and the world of their vessels.

original: dpe gnyi ga blang ba yin yang de'i phyir sems can gyi dbang du byas nas dper bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dpe gnyi ga blang ba yin yang de'i phyir sems can gyi dbang du byas nas dper bstan pa yin te /
translated: Although both examples are taken, nevertheless, the example is taught from the perspective of sentient beings.

original: phal cher dbugs 'byung rngub la brten pas 'di la 'chi ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal cher dbugs 'byung rngub la brten pas 'di la 'chi ba'i chos yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the dharma of death, since it is based on the inhalation and exhalation of breath.

original: gzhan dag ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas so zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas so zhes zer te /
translated: Others say that the other three are based on the physical cosmos.

original: shin tu nyams dga' bar snang ba 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu nyams dga' bar snang ba 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the destruction of the appearance of the very delightful physical cosmos.

original: yang na ming gi 'jig rten dang gzugs kyi 'jig rten zhes brjod de /
analyzed: yang na ming gi 'jig rten dang gzugs kyi 'jig rten zhes brjod de /
translated: Or else, the world of name and the world of form are mentioned.

original: 'di la ming gi 'jig rten ni gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: 'di la ming gi 'jig rten ni gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The world of name is the nature of the four formless aggregates.

original: de yang ming gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang ming gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of name.

original: khams lhag ma ni gzugs kyi 'jig rten te /
analyzed: khams lhag ma ni gzugs kyi 'jig rten te /
translated: The remaining elements are the world of form.

original: gzugs kyis mtshon pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi dngos po mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyis mtshon pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi dngos po mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are indicated by form and because they are the nature of the self and the stage of non-equipoise.

original: 'di na lta byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid shes pas rtogs shing mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di na lta byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid shes pas rtogs shing mthong ba'o //
translated: Here, the one who sees is the one who realizes and sees through the transcendent suchness knowledge.

original: 'chi bdag rgyal po zhes bya ba ni 'chi bdag gi rgyal po nyid kyis srid pa gsum na khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi bdag rgyal po zhes bya ba ni 'chi bdag gi rgyal po nyid kyis srid pa gsum na khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The so-called king of death is the king of death himself, because he pervades the three worlds.

original: des mthong bar mi 'gyur ba ni zil gyis gnon par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des mthong bar mi 'gyur ba ni zil gyis gnon par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He is not seen, i.e., he is not overcome, by that.

original: khams gsum yongs su rtogs pas 'brel pa med de /
analyzed: khams gsum yongs su rtogs pas 'brel pa med de /
translated: He is not related to the thorough understanding of the three worlds.

original: dgra bcom par gyur na ni 'chi ba las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom par gyur na ni 'chi ba las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he becomes an arhat, he transcends death.

original: yang na bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par 'khor ba na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bskal pa'am bskal pa las lhag par 'khor ba na gnas pa'o //
translated: Or, he remains in cyclic existence for an eon or more than an eon.

original: yang na bya ba med pa'i phyir bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'di'i don to //
analyzed: yang na bya ba med pa'i phyir bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'di'i don to //
translated: Or, the meaning is that he attains nirvana in the interval, because he has no more to do.

original: dngos po thams cad yongs su brtag pa dang / dngos po'i phyogs gcig yongs su brtag pa dang 'brel pa yin no zhes @100a * //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad yongs su brtag pa dang / dngos po'i phyogs gcig yongs su brtag pa dang 'brel pa yin no zhes @100a * //
translated: This is related to the investigation of all entities and the investigation of one part of an entity.

original: bsgrub pa'i phyir /üîΩde bzhin lus la lta byed pa //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i phyir / de bzhin lus la lta byed pa //
translated: In order to prove that,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn the same way, one who sees the body. ‚Äù

original: lus ni nang gi gzugs te /
analyzed: lus ni nang gi gzugs te /
translated: The body is internal form.

original: de'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa la 'jug pa'i sbyor bas dang por nang gi lus dang phyi rol gyi lus la 'di ltar yongs su lta bar byed de de'i 'og tu don gzhan yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa la 'jug pa'i sbyor bas dang por nang gi lus dang phyi rol gyi lus la 'di ltar yongs su lta bar byed de de'i 'og tu don gzhan yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the beginning, by the application of engaging in the cultivation of the foundations of mindfulness, one should look in this way at the internal body and the external body. After that, the other topics are taught.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: lus dang 'brel pa de'i yongs su brtag pa gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgang la byis pa mngon phyogs pa //
analyzed: lus dang 'brel pa de'i yongs su brtag pa gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir / gang la byis pa mngon phyogs pa //
translated: In order to teach another investigation of that which is related to the body,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe childish are attached to what is in front of them. ‚Äù

original: tshe dang ldan pa yul 'khor skyong rab tu 'byung ba'i brtul zhugs grub par gyur pa las pham la phan gdags pa'i phyir sthu la ko shtha zhes bya ba der song ngo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa yul 'khor skyong rab tu 'byung ba'i brtul zhugs grub par gyur pa las pham la phan gdags pa'i phyir sthu la ko shtha zhes bya ba der song ngo //
translated: The venerable RƒÅ·π£·π≠rapƒÅla, having accomplished the vow of going forth, went to Sth≈´lake≈õa in order to benefit PƒÅ·π≠ala.

original: de'i sems gzung ba'i phyir de'i mas bsgo ste /
analyzed: de'i sems gzung ba'i phyir de'i mas bsgo ste /
translated: In order to capture his mind, his mother ordered

original: rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i sngon gyi gnyis pa de'i gan du btang ste /
analyzed: rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i sngon gyi gnyis pa de'i gan du btang ste /
translated: that a former lover of his, adorned with ornaments, be sent to him.

original: bud med de'i g-yo bstan pa las /
analyzed: bud med de'i g-yo bstan pa las /
translated: From the display of that woman,

original: de nas slar log pa dang des de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa brgyad gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas slar log pa dang des de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa brgyad gsungs so //
translated: Then, when he returned, the Buddha, the Blessed One, spoke to him these eight verses.

original: blta bar gyis zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis nges par brtag par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: blta bar gyis zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis nges par brtag par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Look! means you must investigate!

original: lus 'dis zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: lus 'dis zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: This body means the body that is the nature of form.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni rgyun du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni rgyun du'o //
translated: Always means continuously.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: smras pa / bkra ba zhes bya ba ste gos dang rgyan la sogs pas brgyan cing mdog khyad du gyur pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: smras pa / bkra ba zhes bya ba ste gos dang rgyan la sogs pas brgyan cing mdog khyad du gyur pa'i phyir ro /
translated: It is said: beautiful, because it is adorned with clothes, ornaments, etc., and has a special color.

original: rgyal po'i shing rta ltar zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i shing rta shin tu bkra ba ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i shing rta ltar zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i shing rta shin tu bkra ba ste /
translated: Like a king's chariot means a king's chariot is very beautiful.

original: phyi rol gser la sogs pas yongs su brgyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gser la sogs pas yongs su brgyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is completely adorned with gold, etc. on the outside.

original: nang ni shing gi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: nang ni shing gi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: But inside it is made of wood.

original: dpe de dang 'dra bar lus 'di yang phyi rol ni shin tu mdzes pa'i phyir dang / nang ni mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe de dang 'dra bar lus 'di yang phyi rol ni shin tu mdzes pa'i phyir dang / nang ni mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, this body is beautiful on the outside, but inside it is by nature impure.

original: gang la byis pa mngon chags pa //
analyzed: gang la byis pa mngon chags pa //
translated: The childish are attached to it,

original: zhes bya ba yongs su rtog par mi byed pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yongs su rtog par mi byed pa ni /
translated: but the wise are not attracted to it.

original: lus gang la lhag par 'dod chags skyed par byed de /
analyzed: lus gang la lhag par 'dod chags skyed par byed de /
translated: The childish generate attachment to the body,

original: phyi rol tsam la lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol tsam la lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they only see the external.

original: de la mkhas pa chags mi byed //üîΩces bya ba ni 'di la 'dod chags dang bral ba skyed par byed de /
analyzed: de la mkhas pa chags mi byed // ces bya ba ni 'di la 'dod chags dang bral ba skyed par byed de /
translated: The wise are not attracted to it,

original: nang gi de nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi de nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they see its internal reality.üîΩThe cause of attachment and non-attachment to the childish and the wise is taught:

original: byis pa dang mkhas pa'i rjes su chags pa @100b dang / 'dod chags dang bral pa'i rgyu bstan pa ni gang la byis pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa dang mkhas pa'i rjes su chags pa @100b dang / 'dod chags dang bral pa'i rgyu bstan pa ni gang la byis pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The childish are attached to it,

original: rab tu rmongs pa ni shin tu mi shes pas zil gyis non cing /
analyzed: rab tu rmongs pa ni shin tu mi shes pas zil gyis non cing /
translated: but the wise are not attracted to it.üîΩThe childish are attached to the body, because they are overcome by great ignorance and delusion,

original: 'khrul pa'am phyin ci log bzhis skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'am phyin ci log bzhis skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are born from the four errors or misconceptions.

original: de la 'dir gti mug gis ni mngon par chags par 'gyur la shes pas ni chags pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la 'dir gti mug gis ni mngon par chags par 'gyur la shes pas ni chags pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, the meaning is that one becomes attached through delusion and one becomes free from attachment through knowledge.

original: 'dod chags ni gti mug gis byas pa'i nyes dmigs te smras pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni gti mug gis byas pa'i nyes dmigs te smras pa /
translated: Attachment is the disadvantage created by delusion.üîΩHe says, ‚ÄúOne who has fallen into misfortune‚Äù

original: nyams gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyams gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúDegenerated‚Äù refers toüîΩ

original: khyad par du nyams par ma gyur pa'am yul dag la chags pas de'i ched du nyams par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par du nyams par ma gyur pa'am yul dag la chags pas de'i ched du nyams par gyur pa ste /
translated: One who has not fallen into a special misfortune, or one who has fallen into misfortune for the sake of an object, out of attachment to it.

original: shin tu nyam nga bar ltung bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu nyam nga bar ltung bar gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one has fallen into a very dangerous state.

original: gang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: glang rgan rdza ba tu chud ba bzhin //üîΩzhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: glang rgan rdza ba tu chud ba bzhin // zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: Like an old elephant in a swamp.

original: ji ltar rgas shing 'khogs pa'i glang 'byung bar mi nus pa'i 'dam gyi nang du zhugs par gyur na de las ni rang gis kyang thar par mi nus la gzhan gyis kyang dbyung du mi rung zhing ma yin pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rgas shing 'khogs pa'i glang 'byung bar mi nus pa'i 'dam gyi nang du zhugs par gyur na de las ni rang gis kyang thar par mi nus la gzhan gyis kyang dbyung du mi rung zhing ma yin pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as an old, decrepit elephant who has entered a swamp that he cannot support himself in, and he is unable to free himself from it, and he cannot be pulled out by others.

original: gang rjes su chags pa de ni shin tu ma rungs pa nyid du bstan la /
analyzed: gang rjes su chags pa de ni shin tu ma rungs pa nyid du bstan la /
translated: That which is attachment is taught to be a great calamity.

original: rma byung ba dang 'dra ba ste //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rma byung ba dang 'dra ba ste // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Like a wound,üîΩit is like a wound that is always destroyed,

original: rma ni rma ral ba dang 'dra bar rtag tu 'jig pa'i phyir dang / 'bad pa byas kyang gso dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rma ni rma ral ba dang 'dra bar rtag tu 'jig pa'i phyir dang / 'bad pa byas kyang gso dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a wound is always destroyed and difficult to heal even with care.

original: byung ba ni rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byung ba ni rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: It arises from causes and conditions.

original: 'dis ni gzhan gyi dbang du bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan gyi dbang du bstan te /
translated: This teaches the other-dependent nature.

original: rtag tu nye bar gdung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i rnam pa bstan pa /
analyzed: rtag tu nye bar gdung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i rnam pa bstan pa /
translated: The teaching on the aspect of being a cause of constant torment

original: nad pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nad pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is stated with the words ‚Äúlike a sick person.‚Äù

original: rgyun du bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i nad kyis mngon par gdungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyun du bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa'i nad kyis mngon par gdungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is constantly tormented by the illness of hunger, thirst, and so on.

original: lus 'di gang du 'gro ba'i sa //
analyzed: lus 'di gang du 'gro ba'i sa //
translated: Wherever this body goes,

original: der ni sdug bsngal 'gro bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //üîΩ'jig chos can zhes bya ba ni nyams par gyur na gsor mi rung ba 'am //
analyzed: der ni sdug bsngal 'gro bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so // 'jig chos can zhes bya ba ni nyams par gyur na gsor mi rung ba 'am //
translated: suffering will follow.üîΩThis is stated with the words ‚ÄúWherever this body goes, suffering will follow.‚ÄùüîΩIt is perishable,

original: slu ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slu ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when it deteriorates, it cannot be healed, or because it has the nature of deception.

analyzed: bstan ma thag pa'i nyes dmigs thams cad 'byung ba ni lus las byung ba yin te /

translated: In the same way, this body, though beautified with collyrium, with a golden necklace on the head, with a pearl necklace on the neck, with bracelets on the forearms, with anklets on the feet, and so on, is by nature a foul-smelling substance.

original: brgyan pa byas kyang dge ba ma yin no //

analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin du ga pur dang / tsan dan la sogs pas lus bskus pa ni lus la bsgos pa'o //

original: btsag gis byugs pa ni li khri dang sen rtsi la sogs pa las byung ba shin tu yid du 'ong zhing mdog dmar bar byas pa'i rkang pa'o //
analyzed: btsag gis byugs pa ni li khri dang sen rtsi la sogs pa las byung ba shin tu yid du 'ong zhing mdog dmar bar byas pa'i rkang pa'o //
translated: The feet are smeared with red dye, which comes from lac, nail polish, and so on, and are very attractive and red in color.

analyzed: blo phyin ci log pas lus la sogs pa la yongs su brtags pa med pas ni chu bo las brgal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the body and so on are imputed by a mistaken mind, one will not cross over the river.

original: gang zhig 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To explain this, it says, ‚ÄúWhoever has desire . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das yul ko sa lar rgyu zhing gshegs nas rim gyis 'od ma'i tshal du byon pa dang / 'od ma'i tshal na gnas pa'i bram ze dang khyim bdag gis 'di skad ces gsol to //

translated: The Blessed One was traveling through the country of Kosala and gradually arrived at the Bamboo Grove. The brahmins and householders who lived in the Bamboo Grove said this:

analyzed: btsun pa bdag cag gis ni 'di ltar 'tshal zhing rtogs te /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable, we understand and know this:

original: 'dod ba la longs spyad par bgyis kyang /
analyzed: 'dod ba la longs spyad par bgyis kyang /
translated: even if we enjoy desire,

original: nongs pa ma mchis te /
analyzed: nongs pa ma mchis te /
translated: there is no fault.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: 'dis na 'dod pa dag la 'jol nyog tu spyod cing lus dang sems tshim par byed @102a * //
analyzed: 'dis na 'dod pa dag la 'jol nyog tu spyod cing lus dang sems tshim par byed @102a * //
translated: Here, one indulges in desires in a confused way, and satisfies body and mind,

original: kyang ; lus zhig nas lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba gda'o zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: kyang ; lus zhig nas lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba gda'o zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: but after the body breaks up, one is reborn among the gods.

original: 'di ltar de ni 'dod pa spangs pas thob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni 'dod pa spangs pas thob pa yin gyi /
translated: The Blessed One said, This is attained through abandoning desires,

original: 'dod pa longs spyod pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa longs spyod pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: not through enjoying desires.

original: ji srid du tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: ji srid du tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs so //
translated: Up to this point, two verses are spoken.

original: 'dod par zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i phyir ram de'i lus la'o //
analyzed: 'dod par zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i phyir ram de'i lus la'o //
translated: Here, in desires means for the sake of the five sense objects, or in relation to them.

original: gang kun du sbyor pas byas pa'i kun du 'brel pa ni rab tu chags pa dang / g-yeng ba dang / 'du 'dzi'o //
analyzed: gang kun du sbyor pas byas pa'i kun du 'brel pa ni rab tu chags pa dang / g-yeng ba dang / 'du 'dzi'o //
translated: The connection created by attachment is strong attachment, distraction, and busyness.

original: de la chags pa ni rab tu zhen pa ste /
analyzed: de la chags pa ni rab tu zhen pa ste /
translated: Here, attachment means strong clinging,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bsags pa dang srung ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bsags pa dang srung ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the engagement in hoarding, accumulating, and guarding, and so on.

original: yang na kun du sbyor pa'i bdag nyid de chags pa dang / sred pa'o //
analyzed: yang na kun du sbyor pa'i bdag nyid de chags pa dang / sred pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the nature of the fetters, i.e., passion and craving.

original: snying rje yang chags pa dang tshul 'dra ba yin no zhe na /üîΩkun du sbyor ba zhes smos pa'i phyir chags pa ni /
analyzed: snying rje yang chags pa dang tshul 'dra ba yin no zhe na / kun du sbyor ba zhes smos pa'i phyir chags pa ni /
translated: Compassion is similar to passion.

original: sems can gyi 'ching ba yin par bstan te /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'ching ba yin par bstan te /
translated: Because the fetters are mentioned, passion is taught to be the bondage of sentient beings.

original: mi shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i g-yeng ba dang / chags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i g-yeng ba dang / chags pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the expression ‚Äúdistraction preceded by ignorance and passion‚Äù is this:

original: kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni rgyal po gshegs zhes bya ba bzhin du kun du sbyor ba 'dir brjod pa yang kun du sbyor ba'i rang bzhin chags pa dang sred pa'i bdag nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni rgyal po gshegs zhes bya ba bzhin du kun du sbyor ba 'dir brjod pa yang kun du sbyor ba'i rang bzhin chags pa dang sred pa'i bdag nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúfetters‚Äù should be understood to have the nature of the fetters, i.e., passion and craving, just as the expression ‚Äúthe king‚Äôs coming‚Äù is understood to refer to the king‚Äôs retinue.

original: gang kun du sbyor ba dag la skyon dang nyes par ma rtogs pa de nyid mi shes pas gnas shing chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang kun du sbyor ba dag la skyon dang nyes par ma rtogs pa de nyid mi shes pas gnas shing chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who does not understand the faults and problems of the fetters remains in ignorance and is attached.

original: gang yang de ltar 'dod pa'i kun du sbyor bas 'dod pa la sred cing chags par gyur na ni nam du yang 'dod pa'i chu bo dang 'dod pa'i zag pa las mi rgal cing spong ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gang yang de ltar 'dod pa'i kun du sbyor bas 'dod pa la sred cing chags par gyur na ni nam du yang 'dod pa'i chu bo dang 'dod pa'i zag pa las mi rgal cing spong ba ma yin na /
translated: If one is attached to and craves for sense objects due to the fetter of desire, then one never crosses over the river of sense objects and abandons the sense-desires.

original: gzhan lta ci smos /
analyzed: gzhan lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention the other fetters?

original: mngon par mi 'dod pa'i gnas su khyer bar byed pa'i phyir chu bo'o //
analyzed: mngon par mi 'dod pa'i gnas su khyer bar byed pa'i phyir chu bo'o //
translated: The river is so called because it carries one off to undesirable places.

original: chu bo ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: chu bo ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the river like?

original: yangs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yangs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is vast,

original: 'gro ba'i bdag nyid thams cad la brten cing khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bdag nyid thams cad la brten cing khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is based on and pervades the whole nature of the world.

original: mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i srid pa nas bsten pa'i phyir dang / shes pa zag pa med pa'i snying pos spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i srid pa nas bsten pa'i phyir dang / shes pa zag pa med pa'i snying pos spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is endless, because it is based on beginningless samsara and because it is abandoned by the core of undefiled knowledge.

original: de lta na yang chu bo rnam pa bzhi po thams cad kyang brgal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang chu bo rnam pa bzhi po thams cad kyang brgal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, nevertheless, one crosses over all four rivers, he says:

original: chags bral mchog dang tha ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chags bral mchog dang tha ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The supreme and the lowest of those free from attachment, etc.

original: chags bral mchog ces bya ba ni gong ma'i @102b kun du sbyor ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags bral mchog ces bya ba ni gong ma'i @102b kun du sbyor ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term supreme means that one is detached from the higher realms, because one abandons the fetters of the higher realms.

original: chags bral tha ma zhes bya ba ni 'og ma'i cha'i kun du sbyor ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags bral tha ma zhes bya ba ni 'og ma'i cha'i kun du sbyor ba spangs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni 'dra mthong ste //

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar gyur pa nyid kyis 'jig tshogs la sogs pa'i lta ba la spyod do //

analyzed: mthong ba'i tshoms te nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'i rnam par 'grel pa rdzogs so /

analyzed: thog mar nyan thos la so sor thar pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gsungs so //

analyzed: de la gnyis ni rjes su mthun pa'i skabs yin pas legs par spyad pa'i tshoms su bshad zin to //

translated: ‚ÄúWho is able to guard against so many, since the bases of training are so numerous, two hundred and fifty?‚Äù

analyzed: tshul khrims ni rnam pa gnyis te @108a * //

analyzed: phyugs gsod pa dang rtas bsang gi mchod pa la sogs pa ni nyes pa med do zhes bram ze dag smra'o //

original: de bzhin du sh'akya'i yongs su spangs pa ni sdig pa lnga yongs su mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sh'akya'i yongs su spangs pa ni sdig pa lnga yongs su mi bya ba ste /

original: cig shos la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: cig shos la 'bad par bya'o //

original: de yang ji ltar dge bsnyen gyis 'dod pas log par g-yem pa mi bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar dge bsnyen gyis 'dod pas log par g-yem pa mi bya ba bzhin no //

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis nyes par spyod pa thams cad mi bya bar gsungs te /
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis nyes par spyod pa thams cad mi bya bar gsungs te /

analyzed: 'di'i 'bras bu mngon par mi 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag po dang 'brel pa'i drug pa ste spang pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'jug pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: From the perspective of engaging ethics,

analyzed: dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //

analyzed: zhes ba snga ma'i thams cad ces bya ba'i dbang du byas pa ste 'dir ma smos kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: The word all in the first line is to be understood here, although it is not mentioned.

original: yang na sngar bshad pa'i thams cad kyi sgras ni sdig pa mtha' dag yongs su gzung la lhag mas ni de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i dge ba mtha' dag ston pa yin te /

translated: Or else, the word all in the previous explanation includes all sins, and the rest of the verse shows all the virtues which are their antidotes.

original: yang thams cad kyi sgra ni mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: yang thams cad kyi sgra ni mi gzung ngo //
translated: But the word all is not to be taken literally.

original: de la lus la sogs pa thams cad kyi dbye bas mtshon par byed pa ni phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de la lus la sogs pa thams cad kyi dbye bas mtshon par byed pa ni phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: Here, the word all is illustrated by the division of body, etc., and the rest of the verse shows that one should generate the perfection of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: yang na phun sum tshogs pa ni nye bar sgrub par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na phun sum tshogs pa ni nye bar sgrub par byed pa nyid do //
translated: Or else, the perfection is the very means of accomplishment.

original: de yang nges par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang nges par bya ba yin te /
translated: And that is to be ascertained,

original: 'bras bu yid du 'ong bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yid du 'ong bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the means of attaining the pleasant fruit.

original: tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show the fruit of morality, it says:

original: rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
translated: One should thoroughly subdue one's own mind.

original: rang gi sems gdul ba med par ni tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems gdul ba med par ni tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: tshul khrims ni sems zhi ba ma gtogs par gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //

original: yang na 'dis ni tshul khrims @108b dag pa'i rgyu bstan te /
analyzed: yang na 'dis ni tshul khrims @108b dag pa'i rgyu bstan te /

original: sems dul ba sngon du 'gro bas ni tshul khrims rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dul ba sngon du 'gro bas ni tshul khrims rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: With the preceeding taming of the mind, morality becomes pure.

original: 'dis ni sangs rgyas bstan pa yin //
analyzed: 'dis ni sangs rgyas bstan pa yin //

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i gsum po ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i gsum po ste /

analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyang rim pa 'dis ston pa yin te /

original: gang gi phyir ngan 'gro yongs su spang bar bya ba sta /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngan 'gro yongs su spang bar bya ba sta /

original: de'i thabs sdig pa thams cad mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i thabs sdig pa thams cad mi bya'o //

original: bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa blang bar bya ba yin te /

original: de'i thabs dge ba bya ba dang / sems gdul ba ste go rims bzhin du spang ba dang / blang ba de'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i thabs dge ba bya ba dang / sems gdul ba ste go rims bzhin du spang ba dang / blang ba de'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The means for that is the performance of virtue and the control of the mind, respectively, because they are taught as the means for abandoning and adopting.

original: yang na 'dul ba dang mdo sde dang mngon pa'i chos mdor bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'dul ba dang mdo sde dang mngon pa'i chos mdor bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i thabs kyi rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir sbyin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: In order to teach the aspects of the means for perfecting virtue, it is said: by generosity, etc.

original: dge sbyong ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong ni rnam pa bzhi ste /

analyzed: lnga pa ni med do zhes bya ba nas ji srid du sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: There is no fifth, and so on up to by generosity, etc.

original: sbyin pas zhes bya ba zhing bzang po la zas la sogs pa'i sbyin pa btang bas sbyin pa'i gang zag gi bsod nams ni rab tu 'phel zhes bya ba yin te /

original: legs par spyod pa la sogs par 'gyur zhing rgyun 'phel te /
analyzed: legs par spyod pa la sogs par 'gyur zhing rgyun 'phel te /
translated: He becomes one who practices well, etc. and his stream increases.

analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: rtag tu mngon par 'phel ba ni bsod nams yin no zhes mdo las gsungs so //
translated: The sutra says that merit always increases.

original: 'di ltar khyed cag gis phul ba'i bsod snyoms yongs su longs spyod pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin yang khyed kyi bsod nams ni 'phel ba nyid de sdig pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed cag gis phul ba'i bsod snyoms yongs su longs spyod pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin yang khyed kyi bsod nams ni 'phel ba nyid de sdig pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, even though the Tathagata who enjoys the alms given by you has entered nirvana, your merit increases and not your sin.

original: sdig pa can gyi dge slong gi dbang du byas nas /üîΩlegs bsdams dgra sogs mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi dge slong gi dbang du byas nas / legs bsdams dgra sogs mi 'gyur ro //
translated: With regard to sinful monks,üîΩhe says,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the well restrained do not become enemies, etc.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni gang gi dgra yang sogs par mi 'gyur te /üîΩgzhan la gnod pa dang gdung ba mi byed cing dge sbyong du byed pa @109a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni gang gi dgra yang sogs par mi 'gyur te / gzhan la gnod pa dang gdung ba mi byed cing dge sbyong du byed pa @109a * //
translated: Through morality, one does not become an enemy to anyone,

original: dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not harm or torment others, and because one is endowed with the practice of virtue.
